verses.verse: Oh <WH3863> that thou wouldest rend<WH7167> the heavens<WH8064>, that thou wouldest come down<WH3381>, that the mountains<WH2022> might quake<WH2151> at thy presence<WH6440>,

as when fire<WH784> kindleth<WH6919> the brushwood<WH2003>, and the fire<WH784> causeth the waters<WH4325> to boil<WH1158>; to make thy name<WH8034> known<WH3045> to thine adversaries<WH6862>, that the nations<WH1471> may tremble<WH7264> at thy presence<WH6440>!
When thou didst<WH6213> terrible things<WH3372> which we looked<WH6960> not for<WH3381>, thou camest down, the mountains<WH2022> quaked<WH2151> at thy presence<WH6440>.

For from of old<WH5769> men have not heard<WH8085>, nor perceived by the ear<WH238>, neither hath the eye<WH5869> seen<WH7200> a God<WH430> besides<WH2108> thee<WH6213>, who worketh for him that waiteth for him<WH2442>.

Thou meetest<WH6293> him that rejoiceth<WH7797> and worketh<WH6213> righteousness<WH6664>, those that remember<WH2142> thee in thy ways<WH1870>: behold<WH7107>, thou wast wroth, and we sinned<WH2398>: in them have we been of long time<WH5769>; and shall we be saved<WH3467>?

For we are all become as one that is unclean<WH2931>, and all our righteousnesses<WH6666> are as a polluted<WH5708> garment<WH899>: and we all do fade<WH5034> as a leaf<WH5929>; and our iniquities<WH5771>, like the wind<WH7307>, take us away<WH5375>.

And there is none that calleth<WH7121> upon thy name<WH8034>, that stirreth up<WH5782> himself to take hold<WH2388> of thee<WH5641>; for thou hast hid thy face<WH6440> from us<WH4127>, and hast consumed us by means<WH3027> of our iniquities<WH5771>.
But now<WH3068>, O Jehovah, thou art our Father<WH1>; we are the clay<WH2563>, and thou our potter<WH3335>; and we all are the work<WH4639> of thy hand<WH3027>.
Be not wroth<WH7107> very sore<WH3966>, O Jehovah<WH3068>, neither remember<WH2142> iniquity<WH5771> for ever<WH5703>: behold<WH5027>, look, we beseech thee<WH5971>, we are all thy people.
Thy holy<WH6944> cities<WH5892> are become a wilderness<WH4057>, Zion<WH6726> is become a wilderness<WH4057>, Jerusalem<WH3389> a desolation<WH8077>.
Our holy<WH6944> and our beautiful<WH8597> house<WH1004>, where our fathers<WH1> praised<WH1984> thee<WH8316>, is burned with fire<WH784>; and all our pleasant places<WH4261> are laid waste<WH2723>.
Wilt thou refrain<WH662> thyself for these things<WH3068>, O Jehovah? wilt thou hold thy peace<WH2814>, and afflict<WH6031> us very sore<WH3966>?
